ratings.comment: Worst professor I have had in college and I took this class as a junior. First exam average 34%. I didn't learn anything in labs either, they were a huge waste of time. Avoid this guy AT ALLL COSTS!
Tough class but pretty good lecturer.

Got an A, very fortunately. His course is definitely not easy. Tough labs, difficult homework and over-average exams. It seems that he do not like to give an A. 11% got an A, while 16% got an AB, which is different from normal curve.
Sam is a terrible professor. His lectures and homeworks are useless for the exams. rely entirely on your TA.. avoid him at all costs, even if you have to take a semester off.

I got a B - he is definitely not the worst professor as is described on here. His labs are hard and his exams do require a lot of thinking and hard work, but that does not mean he is a bad professor. He changed the setting of the exams when people complained so he does listen. The exams did get easier too. He was an average teacher.

*Disclaimer - I got a D in the course due to working full time & not doing the homework. That being said, he is not the terrible professor these reviews imply. 2 of the exams were made up of the exact homework problems. Class average was 90% on homework, but 40-60% on exams which were the same problems...

The only thing that makes me angrier than his voice, is the fact that I am paying this man to teach me. After two semesters of his physics (201 + 202) I can without a doubt say I have learned nothing. Do not take his lecture unless you have to. Take 104 or 208 instead. Paying Hokin to teach you is basically flushing your money down the drain.

If I could go back, I would take this class at MATC or at another UW school rather than take it with Hokin. School is expensive and you deserve to learn something for your money. Hokin teaches way above the prerequisite level and is a very intimidating person, I learned very little in this class except how to jump through his hoops.

Hokin is a horrible teacher, I had to rely entirely on my TA to understand anything. Physics 202 should not be a weed out class, but Hokin sure ran it that way. Avoid at all costs! You will hate having this professor, and if you put your best into this class, you could still end up with a 'B' based on his awful grading system.

Samuel "Danger" Hokin is just that; dangerous.  "It's dangerous not to attend my lectures, it's dangerous not to do my homework."  In reality all lecture, hw, and labs are completely useless.  You will learn nothing and be tested as if you are a phD physics student.  But hey, at least all of his demos are "Classics".

Hypothetically, if you only needed to take physics 202 to graduate and your only option was to take it with Hokin, you should take a semester off, work at Burger king, and hope that someone else teaches it the next semester so that you can finally graduate. That being said he seems like a pretty cool guy outside of school.
Avoid Avoid Avoid Avoid Avoid Avoid!!!!! just a horrible professor
He knows how to make life stressful confusing and frustrating.

His standards are VERY high, but he schedules a lot of office hours and hints heavily towards what's on the exams during lectures (still incredibly hard). Unfortunately, he spends most of lecture deriving equations without showing how to use them (very few examples) and labs are pointless. He's convinced h/w is easy and takes a few hours. Nope.

Sam is hard, he's not very helpful as in a good portion of his lectures are deriving equations that we never use on tests/exams. Non of his lecture material, homework questions and exams are similar in anyway even though he likes to defend they are. Exam medians are in the 30s. I would avoid Sam if possible.

This professor does not outline his requirements. They are vague and almost  unattainable. This is the hardest professor to get a B in. If you can delay a year in physics just to avoid him. He's not worth your time. If you can't SWICH MAJORS

AWFUL. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Sam's lectures and homework are 100% useless because neither one represents what the tests will be like. Exams are extremely difficult for general physics students (30-40% averages). Read the book and get a tutor, because unless you're usually at the top of the class you will struggle mightily for a B

Please avoid this professor at all costs. You WILL have you teach yourself this course, as Sam Hokin will not. He is also not clear during lecture and skims over stuff. Try and get another professor if possible, if not then go to all your TA sessions as he is your best friend. Read the book! and make friends so you can do homework's together.

Does not teach during lecture. Tests are 100% different from online homework sets.  Makes you work harder than any other physics professor just for a B.  Labs are useless and you will not get a good grade unless you make up a totally new experiment.  Avoid Sam Hokin.  Wait another semester until there is a different professor.

Worst teacher I have ever had. Claims to emphasize "conceptual learning", then throws calc and algebra that we havent touched since high school on the exam, so be sure to be good with math. Very erratic grader. Find a good study group/tutor, and know how to derive everything because the formula sheets on exams are useless. Avoid at all costs.

THIS PROFESSOR MAKES YOU WORK SO HARD JUST FOR a B. His grading scale for lab is so stringent, vague and without due process. If you have to have to take physics with him be prepared to be satisfied with an B

One of the worst professors I have ever had. Extremely unorganized and unclear on the topics he is trying to teach. Never explains demos and moves quickly through examples as if they are just a formality. Labs are graded on an extremely unreasonable scale. Read the book and ask questions in discussion. Your TA is your best friend.

Hokin is one of the worst professors I have ever had. He will refuse to give you an A in lab if you don't make up your own experiment. I had him for two semesters and his rules are inconsistent. He never teaches you how to do the homework and his exams are really difficult. If you don't know physics going in then he doesn't like you. Try to avoid!

Nice guy, ineffective/ borderline useless teacher. Is not able to communicate an understanding of physics to his students whatsoever. Only take if you already know intro physics, or good at teaching yourself from the book, which is also terrible.

Awful. Teaches the class as if he's talking to the top student in the class. Spends most of the time deriving equations and doing demos that have nothing to do with what we need to know. Does not even explain the useless demos and emphasizes "conceptual learning" way too much. Avoid at all costs.

Worst teacher I've ever had. Lectures are 100% useless and he acts like everyone already knows everything- if you ask a question he'll make you feel stupid. Tests have NOTHING to do with what you learned: the average on our final exam was 28%. Unless you are already a genius at physics you'll get stuck with a bad grade. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Hokin's lectures are not well organized. He knows his materials but he assumes the students know most of the stuff and he thinks of the class as a review. Also he does 5 demos at a time and as soon as the demos are done, he does not explain about it. If you have a solid background in physics then you can take hokin, if not choose a different prof.

My TA explains concepts better than Hokin. He assumes you know everything and makes it hard to ask questions. Rather disorganized - He spends lecture deriving equations, sometimes goes off on tangents, and goes overtime. He'll be excited about the demos...and start 5 at a time. Do the book problems, because lectures won't help much.

He doesnt go over any useful information in the lecture that will actually help to succeed on either the test or in the real world. His tests are better for you if you simply memorize the formulas than if you actually understand the concepts becuase of the nitpicky types of questions. also he cant write a single clear question in his tests
He seems to assume that everyone already knows what he is teaching and he is reminding us of it. It makes it very hard to actually learn.
Terrible, just terrible. Lecture had no relation to exams and he had to ramble about his Liberal during the Scott Walker budget bill. Horrible excuse for an educator.

Class had the potential to be really easy, but he does a very poor job of explaining concepts.  It is often hard to distinguish what is important/what is not and what he is explaining at all.  Always willing to help, you just have to be able to understand his explaination

He presents a different view of the subject than the book, which is interesting but not always helpful.  Is willing to answer questions and discuss after class.   Tests are difficult (5 questions, 3 exams total) and are often a tangent from the homework problems--overall emphasizes concepts.

The lecture was 100% useless. Hokin pretty much used the time to ramble off proofs to equations that you will never use. The book was the best source of info. As far as the tests go, the only study you should do is make your notecard... he gives 5 problems each exam, every problem will be like nothing you have ever seen before and 10x harder. AVOID
